stem: Given question: James and Ruth were getting a divorce.  It was amicable, but it wasn't happy.  There was a lot of what emotion? and answer: sadness, explain why in
no_more_50_words: Divorces are difficult, and even the amicable ones are sad as they signify the end of relationships.
150_to_200_words:
James and Ruth were getting a divorce, and while it was amicable, it wasn't happy.  This situation often brings with it a lot of sadness.  Even though both parties are mutually agreeing to the divorce, it is still an emotional time for both.  Neither one wants to end a marriage, but in order to move on with their lives, they have to do what is best for them both.

The sadness that comes with a divorce is often compounded by the fact that the couple has to dissolve their lives together.  They may have shared many dreams and goals, but now they have to find a way to go their separate paths.  They may have to divide assets, determine who will have custody of the children, and even decide how to stay in touch with one another as they move forward in their new lives. 

The sadness may also come from the fact that the relationship didn't work out the way they had envisioned.  Even if both parties are happy with the decision to divorce, they may still experience sadness when they think of the time they spent together and the life they had planned.
